name: Oneohtrix Point Never
description:
'''Daniel Lopatin''' (born July 25, 1982), best known as '''Oneohtrix Point Never''' or '''OPN''', is an American [[electronic music]] producer, composer, singer, and songwriter.  His work experiments with [[wikt:trope|trope]]s from an eclectic range of musical genres and eras, and has featured [[Sampling (music)|sample]]-based composition and complex [[MIDI]] production. He began releasing music in the 2000s, and received early acclaim for the [[synthesizer]]-based compilation ''[[Rifts (Oneohtrix Point Never album)|Rifts]]'' (2009) as well as the influential [[vaporwave]] side-project ''[[Chuck Person's Eccojams Vol. 1]]'' (2010).

Lopatin signed with [[Warp (record label)|Warp]] in 2013, and has since released studio albums on the label to positive critical reception. He has also contributed production work to various artists, most extensively [[the Weeknd]], [[Moses Sumney]], and [[Soccer Mommy]]. He has composed [[Film score|score]]s for films such as ''[[Good Time (film)|Good Time]]'' (2017), ''[[Uncut Gems]]'' (2019), and ''[[Marty Supreme]]'' (2025); the first won him the Soundtrack Award at the [[2017 Cannes Film Festival]].
